title: NA every year.
body: Another year and NA still doesn't learn. They never play the NA play style in the world tournaments. Almost every game NA lane swaps (TSM and C9 especially), yet as soon as it's international play... Time to try something new. Every year...

replies.body:
That's not the only thing that happens every year...

Every year hundreds of people travel to good old Camp Dyrus...  you would think after all the deaths they would send someone to close the camp. However that camp remains open to this day, some say it will never close. In fact Camp Dyrus has officially surpassed Auschwitz in causalities by this point. Yet for some unknown reason... no one bothers to close the camp(they could at least TRY counterganking top for a change... the shock value alone could win them a match).

> [{quoted}](name=Focus Teemo,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=IZ8U349G,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-05-08T05:25:51.176+0000)

> That's not the only thing that happens every year...

However that camp remains open to this day, some say it will never close. In fact Camp Dyrus has officially surpassed Auschwitz in causalities by this point. Yet for some unknown reason... no one bothers to close the camp(they could at least TRY counterganking top for a change... the shock value alone could win them a match).

Breaking news: This just in with Anchorman Nautilus on the scene.

{{champion:111}}  Im here at Camp Dyrus with Bengi and Reignover , they have stated "Camp Dyrus is the best camp i have ever been a part of".
{{champion:111}} Camp counselor Dyrus has gone on record to say "I just want to play League of legends". Back to you in the studio.

{{champion:40}} Alright thanks Nautilus, next up is the church of SKT. Deranged cult or seekers of truth? More at 11.
I read this in the champion voices, and it makes me just want Anchorman Nautilus more and more.
10/10 Would watch this news at 11.

a well, i donßt think they would have won by swapping lanes either. Fnatic came in very well prepared and TSM seemingly just had been without a plan from the get go. It´s always the same thing, they just hype themselves too much and most of the times just fall flat once they meet a real good team. NA-competition is just still lacking as a whole (eu also is a little hit&miss, especially compared to china, but at least the top 3 are quite strong).

> [{quoted}](name=Don Eulrich,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=IZ8U349G,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-07T21:25:36.848+0000)
>
> a well, i donßt think they would have won by swapping lanes either. Fnatic came in very well prepared and TSM seemingly just had been without a plan from the get go. It´s always the same thing, they just hype themselves too much and most of the times just fall flat once they meet a real good team. NA-competition is just still lacking as a whole (eu also is a little hit&miss, especially compared to china, but at least the top 3 are quite strong).

I disagree. Cass is AWFUL in a lane swap. Can't farm, is useless without farm, mediocre in double jungling, awful gank potential. She would be in a terrible position, not to mention Fnatic is extremely reliant on their top laner. This alone would have fatally wounded Fnatic.

Now let's add in safe Sivir farm and how she out scales Urgot. Finally, TSM would feel a lot more comfortable since they almost always lane swap while other regions don't lane swap anywhere near as much giving TSM a huge advantage in experience.

Everything correct except that Cassiopeia can farm every easily in laneswap situations. But I agree, TSM should have laneswapped. Dyrus is no match for Huni and Urgot does no damage lategame. So you just make sure Sivir gets enough farm and Cassiopeia (who is the only real dps threat) doesnt get fed.

Cass is actually decent in laneswaps - she can farm from quite a range, lasthitting underneath the turret is simple and she has insane killpressure early on if she receives aid from a support or/and a jungler.
+ most of what went wrong for TSM had been the midlane, reignover just played so much better than santorin. Wouldnßt have gone any ohter way with a swap there.

They didn't even need to lane swap in my opinion, though that would have helped and should have happened.  Just giving Dyrus a gank would have made that lane go well.  Realistically when the same tops and jungles were played again later on in the day (I can't remember the teams involved) what determined the victory was just giving ganks to top lane.  TSM's style of ignoring top is starting to seriously come back to bite them.  Worse yet, dyrus's lack of skill has become more prominent in his bad decision making and overestimating what he can take and do.  His failure against cass earlier with gnar wasn't the worst thing since he only died due to ganks.  However, when given hecarim against gnar he failed to play the lane out right.  overall, every lane did quite poorly and santorin was unquestionably useless in the games lost.  The whole team did bad, period.

NA teams have always been trash compared to any other continent.  They lose the laning phase, they lose the team fight phase, they lose at objectives, and they lose matches.  Lots of greedy play, lots of miscalculated tower dives, lots of poor positioning, lack of vision control(or vision in general), and lots of poor shot calling.  There's just nothing exciting about watching them.  Even basic mechanics on the NA side seem very lacking.
TSM always lose game 1 just saying.

Yeah they do, but that doesn't mean you abandon all common sense cause that's just how you role. Gnar doesn't beat Cassi, like ever. Cassi is immobile, Rek'sai snowballs hard off ganks, what do you? Well if you're TSM, you just afk farm on a gank heavy jungler against a Cassi pushing the lane. I get that Dyrus isn't the guy on TSM you're aiming to snowball, but there comes a time when you need to help him or you just lose the game. You don't try out shit in an international tournament, you do that in scrims or during your regional LCS.

I honestly didnt think people still watched things that aren';t worlds.
I gave up watching all that shit in season 2.

Same meta for the last 3 years.

I could name the champs played in every role for the last 3 years and they would've hardly changed outside of jungle and top lane its just the same shit lol.
I'll take: What's a tank meta? for 200, Alex.
{{champion:6}} and {{champion:111}} doe...
This past season has actually shown more diversity than the previous 2 seasons combined.
you can pretty much tell teh games lost as soon as TSM picks urgot. that champion just does not suit their style of play.

> [{quoted}](name=TurtleOSP,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=IZ8U349G,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-05-07T21:16:47.514+0000)
>
> Another year and NA still doesn't learn. They never play the NA play style in the world tournaments. Almost every game NA lane swaps (TSM and C9 especially), yet as soon as it's international play... Time to try something new. Every year...

You may still need more time before this happens, but not supporting TSM (at least internationally) will save you lots of stress (I had to finally give up on them before the days of Bjerg and Loco).  They obviously can't compete well internationally unless there are flukes like at IEM.  Things that will help TSM are getting a better top/adc (Dyrus just needs to retire and Turtle's been falling off for sometime) and getting new ownership that isn't toxic.

Lets make  a small genesis of what NA did during past several seasons - 

Season 2 - American style failed horribly. No one passed the group stage. 
Season 3 - Overall better, C9 stood up, their team game was awesome, however Koreans were too strong
Season 4 - Lets import everything, Korean supports, European mid laners, Chinese ad carries - Backfired again. 
Season 5 - I highly doubt, unless huge change comes, that any NA team will pass the group stage at worlds. Even Europeans realized how they should play this type of matches. They realized they will have to react on enemy team, not to play your game and be like " Fuck you, i am going to play my style, i don't care if you counter picked half of my team" 

NA can learn lot of FNC right now.

NA does not have a typical mechanical genius  like Koreans or even Europeans do.

Listening to people talk about pro players is like hearing people talk about pros that play another game than you do. You might as well be talking about DOTA pros. How could a had full of people be so influential over millions? The first thing people should copy from the pros is building teams.
